snippet: Martin Sorrell, the chief executive of the advertising giant WPP, became the latest British executive on Wednesday to have his pay package rejected by a majority of shareholders, Julia Werdigier writes in The New York Times.
abstract: Martin Sorrell, the chief executive of the advertising giant WPP, became the latest British executive on Wednesday to have his pay package rejected by a majority of shareholders, Julia Werdigier writes in The New York Times.

headline.main: Shareholders Reject Pay Package for WPP's Chief
